recipe.name: Burek
recipe.description: Burek is a traditional pastry found in the cuisines of the Balkans, North Africa, and Central Asia. It consists of layers of thin filo pastry filled with a savory mixture, commonly minced meat and onions, then baked until golden and crispy.
steps: In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat and fry the onions until translucent.
Add the minced beef to the pan, season with salt and pepper, and cook until the meat is browned. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Grease a round baking tray with oil.
Place a layer of filo pastry on the tray, brushing it with oil.
Spread a thin layer of the meat filling over the pastry.
Cover with another layer of filo pastry, brush with oil, and repeat the layering process until you have five or six layers, finishing with a layer of filo pastry on top.
Brush the top layer with oil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
Remove from the oven, let it cool slightly, cut into quarters, and serve.
Nothing beats homemade goodness—time to enjoy!
